title: aria-sort attribute
description: Indicates if items in a table or grid are sorted in ascending or descending order.

assertions.title: convey the 'ascending' value
assertions.rationale: Screen reader users need to be aware that the data associated with the header is currently sorted in ascending order.
examples: Screen readers will convey the 'ascending' value as something like "sorted ascending" or "sort up" when navigating to the header or one of its cells.

assertions.title: convey the 'descending' value
assertions.rationale: Screen reader users need to be aware that the data associated with the header is currently sorted in descending order.
examples: Screen readers will convey the 'descending' value as something like "sorted descending" or "sort down" when navigating to the header or one of its cells.

assertions.title: convey the 'none' value either by omitting any sort information or by indicating that the header is unsorted but sortable
assertions.rationale: Screen reader users need to be aware that the data associated with the header is not currently sorted. They may also benefit from knowing that the data is sortable.
examples: Screen readers will convey the 'none' value by omitting any sort announcements when navigating to the header or one of its cells.

assertions.title: convey the 'none' value by indicating that the header is unsorted but sortable
assertions.rationale: Developers may use the 'none' value to indicate to screen reader users that a header is sortable but currently unsorted. However, this behavior is not broadly adopted across screen readers and may diverge from the normative ARIA spec.
examples: Screen readers may convey the 'none' value by indicating that the header is sortable but omitting a current sort direction.

assertions.title: convey the 'other' value
assertions.rationale: Screen reader users need to be aware that the data associated with the header is currently sorted in something other than ascending or descending order.
examples: Screen readers will convey the 'other' value as something like "sorted" or "sorted other" when navigating to the header or one of its cells.

assertions.title: convey changes to the sort value
examples: Screen readers will convey the new sort value after activating a button to change the sort direction.
